newsitem.title: USA: Hilton launches $6.5 billion bid for ITT.
newsitem.headline: Hilton launches $6.5 billion bid for ITT.

text.p: Hilton Hotels Corp., the largest hotel and gambling company in the United States, on Monday launched a $6.5 billion bid for ITT Corp., owner of the Sheraton hotel chain and Caesars World casinos.

Including the assumption of debt, the deal would be worth $10.5 billion. Hilton said it was offering to buy all the outstanding ITT shares in a two-step bid. Hilton will pay $55 per share in cash for the first half of the tender, and will follow that with an offer of $55 a share in Hilton common stock.
